page.title: 05Farming in mid-Norfolk
page.content: The area around Salhouse, Rackheath and Little Plumstead is typical Norfolk farmland with large open fields taking advantage of the flatness of the land.Trees are often seen growing around the edges of the fields acting as a screen to protect the fields from{soil erosion}from the bitter north-easterly wind which blows from late autumn to the early summer. In some areas natural hedges have been left to grow by more conservation minded farmers. Crops grown include{cereals}such as {wheat}and{barley.Sugar beet}and{peas} are also grown.When harvested sugar beet keeps factories at Cantley near Gt Yarmouth and at King's Lynn working 24 hrs a day.{Animal husbandry}is less important than crop growing but{sheep, {cattle}and{pigs}can still be seen.It was wool which once made Norfolk rich.
